verses.verse: My son,<WH1121> attend<WH7181> unto my wisdom,<WH2451> and bow<WH5186> thine ear<WH241> to my understanding: <WH8394>
That thou mayest regard<WH8104> discretion,<WH4209> and that thy lips<WH8193> may keep<WH5341> knowledge.<WH1847>
For <WH3588> the lips<WH8193> of a strange woman<WH2114> drop<WH5197> as a honeycomb,<WH5317> and her mouth<WH2441> is smoother<WH2509> than oil:<WH4480> <WH8081>
But her end<WH319> is bitter<WH4751> as wormwood,<WH3939> sharp<WH2299> as a twoedged<WH6310> sword.<WH2719>
Her feet<WH7272> go down<WH3381> to death;<WH4194> her steps<WH6806> take hold<WH8551> on hell.<WH7585>
Lest <WH6435> thou shouldest ponder<WH6424> the path<WH734> of life,<WH2416> her ways<WH4570> are movable,<WH5128> that thou canst not<WH3808> know<WH3045> them.
Hear <WH8085> me now<WH6258> therefore, O ye children,<WH1121> and depart<WH5493> not<WH408> from the words<WH4480> <WH561> of my mouth.<WH6310>
Remove thy way far<WH7368> <WH1870> from<WH4480> <WH5921> her, and come not nigh<WH7126> <WH408> <WH413> the door<WH6607> of her house: <WH1004>
Lest <WH6435> thou give<WH5414> thine honor<WH1935> unto others,<WH312> and thy years<WH8141> unto the cruel: <WH394>
Lest <WH6435> strangers<WH2114> be filled<WH7646> with thy wealth;<WH3581> and thy labors<WH6089> be in the house<WH1004> of a stranger;<WH5237>
And thou mourn<WH5098> at the last,<WH319> when thy flesh<WH1320> and thy body<WH7607> are consumed,<WH3615>
And say,<WH559> How<WH349> have I hated<WH8130> instruction,<WH4148> and my heart<WH3820> despised<WH5006> reproof;<WH8433>
And have not<WH3808> obeyed<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of my teachers,<WH3384> nor<WH3808> inclined<WH5186> mine ear<WH241> to them that instructed<WH3925> me!
I was<WH1961> almost<WH4592> in all<WH3605> evil<WH7451> in the midst<WH8432> of the congregation<WH6951> and assembly.<WH5712>
Drink <WH8354> waters<WH4325> out of thine own cistern,<WH4480> <WH953> and running waters<WH5140> out of<WH4480> <WH8432> thine own well.<WH875>
Let thy fountains<WH4599> be dispersed<WH6327> abroad,<WH2351> and rivers<WH6388> of waters<WH4325> in the streets.<WH7339>
Let them be<WH1961> only<WH905> thine own, and not<WH369> strangers'<WH2114> with<WH854> thee.
Let thy fountain<WH4726> be<WH1961> blessed:<WH1288> and rejoice<WH8055> with the wife<WH4480> <WH802> of thy youth.<WH5271>

Let her be as the loving<WH158> hind<WH365> and pleasant<WH2580> roe;<WH3280> let her breasts<WH1717> satisfy<WH7301> thee at all<WH3605> times;<WH6256> and be thou ravished<WH7686> always<WH8548> with her love.<WH160>
And why<WH4100> wilt thou, my son,<WH1121> be ravished<WH7686> with a strange woman,<WH2114> and embrace<WH2263> the bosom<WH2436> of a stranger?<WH5237>
For <WH3588> the ways<WH1870> of man<WH376> are before<WH5227> the eyes<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> and he pondereth<WH6424> all<WH3605> his goings.<WH4570>
His own iniquities<WH5771> shall take<WH3920> <WH853> the wicked<WH7563> himself, and he shall be holden<WH8551> with the cords<WH2256> of his sins.<WH2403>
He <WH1931> shall die<WH4191> without<WH369> instruction;<WH4148> and in the greatness<WH7230> of his folly<WH200> he shall go astray.<WH7686>
